data.title: Item Maker
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

frames = {"Common":["###","#","###"], "Rare":["/#\\","#","\\#/"], "Epic":["/-\\","|","\\_/"], "Legendary":["","","X_X"]}

data = input().split(',')

parsed = [x.split(':') for x in data]
itemName = f"-{parsed[0][0]}-"
rarity = parsed[1][0]
parsed = parsed[2:]
attributes = [f"{x[0]} {x[1]}" for x in parsed]
width = max(len(x) for x in (attributes+[itemName, rarity]))


def centered(s):
    res = (" " * (((width-len(s))//2)+((width-len(s))%2)))+s+(" " * ((width-len(s))//2))
    return res



thisFrame = frames[rarity]

if rarity != 'Legendary':

    attributes = [centered(rarity)] + attributes
    attributes = [centered(itemName)] + attributes

    for i in range(len(attributes)):
        attributes[i] = f"{thisFrame[1]} {attributes[i]}{' ' * (width-len(attributes[i]))} {thisFrame[1]}"


    print(f"{thisFrame[0][0]}{thisFrame[0][1] * (width + 2)}{thisFrame[0][2]}")

else:

    attributes = [centered(rarity)] + attributes
    attributes = [centered(itemName)] + attributes

    for i in range(len(attributes)):
        if i == 0:
            attributes[i] = f"[ {attributes[i]}{' ' * (width-len(attributes[i]))} ]"
        else:
            attributes[i] = f"| {attributes[i]}{' ' * (width-len(attributes[i]))} |"


    print(f"X-{'-'*((width-3)//2)}\\_{'_'*((width+1)%2)}/{'-'*((width-3)//2)}-X")



for el in attributes:
    print(el)
print(f"{thisFrame[2][0]}{thisFrame[2][1] * (width + 2)}{thisFrame[2][2]}")


# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)
data.statement:
You are programming a new game, but you have to create an interface for your <<items>>. Unfortunately, the amount of data is high, and you have to write a program to automate it.

Create an ASCII art of the data to add it to the game later. The frame to output depends on [[itemRarity]].

The patterns are the followings:
```
##############
# -ItemName- #
#   Common   #
##############

/############\
# -ItemName- #
#    Rare    #
\############/

/------------\
| -ItemName- |
|    Epic    |
\____________/

X----\__/----X
[ -ItemName- ]
|  Legendary |
X____________X
```

Notes:

- [[ItemName]] and [[ItemRarity]] have to be centered on the item
- To center a text, the extra space goes to the left:
    `"  CenteredText "`
- [[ItemName]] specific line only goes for the {{Legendary}} [[ItemRarity]] items.
- {{Legendary}} items first line depends on the length of the box:
    odd: X---\_/---X (1 {{_}} in the middle)
    even: X---\__/---X (2 {{_}} in the middle)
- Attributes are shown in the same order as input.
- One attribute is shown per line, in the format of [[attribute]] [[value]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are programming a new game, but you have to create an interface for your items. Unfortunately, the amount of data is high, and you have to write a program to automate it.

Create an ASCII art of the data to add it to the game later. The frame to output depends on itemRarity.

The patterns are the followings:

##############
# -ItemName- #
#   Common   #
##############

/############\
# -ItemName- #
#    Rare    #
\############/

/------------\
| -ItemName- |
|    Epic    |
\____________/

X----\__/----X
[ -ItemName- ]
|  Legendary |
X____________X


Notes:

- ItemName and ItemRarity have to be centered on the item
- To center a text, the extra space goes to the left:
    
"  CenteredText "

- ItemName specific line only goes for the Legendary ItemRarity items.
- Legendary items first line depends on the length of the box:
    odd: X---\_/---X (1 _ in the middle)
    even: X---\__/---X (2 _ in the middle)
- Attributes are shown in the same order as input.
- One attribute is shown per line, in the format of attribute value.




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A string data the data to convert into an item in the format of itemName,itemRarity,attribute1:value1,attribute2:value2…

   

   

      
Output

      
The ASCII art of the item ready to be added to the game.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
5 ≤ length of itemName or attribute or value ≤ 100
itemRarity is always Common, Rare, Epic, or Legendary

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
Wooden Sword,Common,Damage:20

         

         

            
Output

            
##################
# -Wooden Sword- #
#     Common     #
# Damage 20      #
##################
